result.execSummary:
All charges against Victoria K Heisz in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Victoria K Heisz is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:33 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Victoria K Heisz in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Victoria K Heisz.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

2022CF000058, 2022CF000082, 2022TR000280, 2022TR000281, 2022TR000282, 2022TR000283 called 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for pleas. Defendant enters no contest pleas. Court accepts the defendants no contest pleas to each case and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters pleas. Court finds the defendant guilty of the following. 

State moves to dismiss Ct 2 in 22CF58, case 22CF82, 22TR280, 22TR281, 22TR282. Court dismisses the count and cases.

Apply total of $500.00 in bonds to be applied. 60DTP. 2 days of credit should defendant be revoked.

1:17 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Victoria K. Heisz appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Victoria K. Heisz.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard. Atty Erickson filed the waiver for preliminary hearing. 

Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds over for further proceedings. 

The information is brought across. Atty Erickson is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.

2022CF000058, 2022GF000121, 2022TR000280, 2022TR000281, 2022TR000282, 2022TR000283 all together 

22GF121
Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $00.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Atty Erickson is heard on bond and requests a signature bond. 
Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $300.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
